abstract: Private equity bidders are reportedly lining up to do battle over the generics business of Germany’s Merck, said to be worth at least 4 billion euros ($5.3 billion). The Financial Times Deutschland reported that Bain Capital and Apax Partners are preparing a joint bid for the business, as are Kohlberg Kravis Roberts and Warburg Pincus. The Carlyle Group is also reportedly mulling a bid.
lead_paragraph: Private equity bidders are reportedly lining up to do battle over the generics business of Germany’s Merck, said to be worth at least 4 billion euros ($5.3 billion). The Financial Times Deutschland reported that Bain Capital and Apax Partners are preparing a joint bid for the business, as are Kohlberg Kravis Roberts and Warburg Pincus. The Carlyle Group is also reportedly mulling a bid.

headline.main: Buyout Firms Circle Unit of German Drugmaker Merck
